item.title: The White House Gold Rush Is On
item.description: They came bearing gifts. They left with what they wanted.

item.title: Elon Musk Can’t Possibly Deserve His $1 Trillion Payday
item.description: In the face of shareholders, corporate boards and even judges, Tesla’s chief executive shows what he can get away with.

item.title: How to Resist a Populist Mayor and a Populist President
item.description: Hochul can show how Democrats wary of a mayor-elect’s populist brand of socialism can push back against it.

item.title: The Comey Case Is Now Officially a Comedy of Errors
item.description: The incompetence of the Trump administration is interfering with some of its worst excesses.

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein’s Victims Are the Real Story
item.description: Women’s pain is not entertainment.

item.title: Nothing Succeeds With Trump Quite Like Success
item.description: Ukraine understands this. Europe should get on board with it, too.

item.title: It’s Deeper Than Nick Fuentes
item.description: Understanding the Right’s antisemitic turn.

item.title: Trump’s Slip With the Saudi Crown Prince
item.description: Readers discuss what President Trump revealed in his meeting with the Saudi crown prince. Also: Albania’s A.I. “civil servant”; bullfighting as torture.

item.title: Our Depressing Vaccine Future Laid Bare on the C.D.C. Website
item.description: Kennedy has a rhetorical advantage in that his deceptions can be definitive while scientific honesty has to come with caveats.

item.title: A.I. Sexbots Are Dangerous. We Should Know.
item.description: At least a quarter of the more than 100 billion messages sent to our chatbots are attempts to initiate romantic or sexual exchanges.

item.title: Patti Smith on the One Desire That Lasts Forever
item.description: Life lessons from the “Godmother of Punk.”

item.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene Was Not on Our Bingo Card
item.description: Have we been selling her short? Is she paving the way to the after-Trump?

item.title: A.I. Is a Bubble. Maybe That’s OK.
item.description: Investors’ excitement rightly reflects the potential transformation of the entire economy.

item.title: The Three Republican Women Who Defied Trump on Epstein
item.description: Lauren Boebert, Marjorie Taylor Greene and Nancy Mace resisted pressure from the president and made the vote to release the Epstein files possible.

item.title: No, Mr. President, We Cannot ‘Leave It at That’
item.description: Working with imperfect partners does not mean that the United States should cover up and lie about their misdeeds.

item.title: American Immigration Isn’t About Biden, Trump or Even America
item.description: All politics is global now — and that's especially true around immigration.

item.title: Rural Kids Need More Than Vocational School
item.description: We need to support working-class kids before the 21st century abandons them completely.

item.title: Trump’s Embrace of the Saudi Crown Prince
item.description: Readers react to the White House meeting between President Trump and the Saudi crown prince. Also: Skin care for little kids; when libraries close.

item.title: What Is Post-Liberalism, Anyway?
item.description: Notes on an unstable but necessary idea.

item.title: Where, oh Where, Will the First Female President Come From?
item.description: The election of Mikie Sherrill and Abigail Spanberger has deepened the pool of potential Oval Office occupants.

item.title: Anorexia Was My Revolt Against Mother Nature
item.description: My sister and I went on a joint diet. She stopped and I didn’t.

item.title: Patreon’s C.E.O.: My Vision for a Better Internet
item.description: The internet should enrich people, not advertisers.

item.title: I’m Building an Algorithm That Doesn’t Rot Your Brain
item.description: The internet should enrich people, not advertisers.

item.title: Trump’s Trade War Showed That China Can Stand Up to America
item.description: Trump’s ill-conceived tariff war exposed U.S. vulnerabilities, strengthened China’s leverage and undermined America at a pivotal time.

item.title: Ecuador’s Iron Fist Is Failing. U.S. Troops Won’t Help.
item.description: Ecuador Can’t Shoot Its Way to Peace

item.title: Am I the Skinniest Person You’ve Ever Seen?
item.description: My sister and I went on a joint diet. She stopped and I didn’t.

item.title: This Is How Our Economy Comes Crashing Down
item.description: Some of the pieces seem fine, but the base is increasingly fragile.

item.title: On Republican Neo-Nazism, Hamas and Israel: An Epidemic of Moral Cowardice
item.description: People with extreme ideology don’t care anymore about hiding their excesses or their agendas. It’s all out there online or on YouTube.

item.title: James Watson Saw the True Form of DNA. Then It Blinded Him.
item.description: James Watson’s legacy is a cautionary tale against letting a profound discovery shape your entire worldview.

item.title: ‘We Lost Our Mission’: Three University Leaders on the Future of Higher Ed
item.description: The view from Dartmouth, the University of Wisconsin-Madison and Wesleyan.

item.title: Who’s Afraid of Tucker Carlson? I Can Think of Two People.
item.description: The price of “no enemies on the right” is going up.

item.title: Views of Consciousness, Human and A.I.
item.description: Readers respond to a guest essay about artificial (and human) intelligence and consciousness. Also: Kennedy Center ripple effects; cobblestone streets.

item.title: Trump Made the Citizenship Test Harder. What if Every American Had to Take It?
item.description: We should not demand ever more knowledge of newcomers and ever less of our current citizens.

item.title: The MAGA Crackup Might Finally Be Here
item.description: Even if the Epstein files never come out, it’s increasingly clear that a Trump coalition is fragmenting.

item.title: The Democrat Who Split MAGA Over the Epstein Files
item.description: Ro Khanna argues that even though there is a risk in releasing the documents, it still needs to happen.

item.title: Inside ICE Detention
item.description: They came to the U.S. legally. ICE jailed them anyway. Jemmy Jimenez Rosa, Ayman Soliman and Jasmine Mooney share their stories from inside a cruel detention system that operates with impunity.

item.title: Mohammed bin Salman Visits D.C. With New Priorities
item.description: The crown prince will meet President Trump with an agenda aimed at protecting the kingdom’s interests.

item.title: Here’s What Trump Should Actually Do for Fertility
item.description: Trump’s policies on in vitro fertilization are underwhelming but his announcement still made me optimistic.

item.title: A Conservative Vision for America After Trump
item.description: Can the right find its way back to small government? Sarah Isgur thinks so.

item.title: Trump’s New Take on the Epstein Files
item.description: Readers react to developments in the Jeffrey Epstein case. Also: A teacher’s suspension.

item.title: The Case for Overthrowing Maduro
item.description: Thinking through the argument for intervention in Venezuela.

item.title: We Immigrated Legally. ICE Detained Us Anyway.
item.description: The brutal detention of three people who came to the U.S. legally reveals a cruel system that operates with impunity.

item.title: Democrats Could Win the Senate in 2026. Here’s How.
item.description: The path is more promising than you think.

item.title: The Lesson We Teach Schoolchildren About the Holocaust Is Wrong
item.description: First they came for whom?

item.title: We Came Here Legally. ICE Locked Us Up Anyway.
item.description: The brutal detention of three people who came to the United States reveals a cruel system that operates with impunity.

item.title: A Christian Answer to Trump and Trumpism Is Finally Here
item.description: Pope Leo doesn’t want to be the anti-Trump. But he is.

item.title: Real Solutions for Women in the Workplace
item.description: Readers respond to a guest essay by Corinne Low about work boundaries.

item.title: The Best Gifts Don’t Cost Money. Tell Us About Your Favorite.
item.description: The gifts that cost the least are sometimes the ones that mean the most. Share yours with NYT Opinion.
